citation.article-title: Streptomyces avicenniae sp. nov., a novel actinomycete isolated from the rhizosphere of the mangrove plant Avicennia mariana
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Streptomyces avicenniae sp. nov.

Streptomyces avicenniae (a.vi.cen′ni.ae. N.L. fem. n. Avicennia scientific name of genus of tree; N.L. fem. gen. n. avicenniae of Avicennia, isolated from the rhizosphere of the plant Avicennia mariana).
Aerobic, Gram-positive actinomycete with branching aerial mycelium and substrate mycelium.
Non-motile and ellipsoid spores with smooth surfaces are borne in compact spiral spore chains with up to eight helixes per chain.
Colony colour is medium-dependent and diffusible pigments are produced on ISP 2 media.
Aerial mycelia are light-yellow on Czapek's agar and Starch agar, yellow–brown on glucose-asparagine agar and ISP 3, olive on ISP 4 and ISP 5, and deep orange–red on ISP 2.
Substrate mycelia are white, grey to light-yellow and deep orange–red on different media.
Growth occurs at temperatures ranging from 15 to 37 °C, with optimum growth at 28 °C.
Raffinose, d-xylose, d-galactose, l-arabinose, l-rhamnose, mannitol and sucrose are utilized, but d-mannose, inositol and d-ribose are not.
Tests for gelatin liquefaction, milk coagulation and peptonization are positive and tests for nitrate reduction, H2S production and melanin production are negative.
Whole-cell hydrolysates contain ribose, xylose, arabinose, galactose and glucose.
Resistant to ciprofloxacin (5 μg), clindamycin (2 μg), furazolidone (15 μg), metronidazole (5 μg), lincomycin (2 μg) and norfloxacin (10 μg).

Sensitive to ampicillin (10 μg), chloromycetin (30 μg), rocephin (30 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), kanamycin (30 μg), cefazolin (30 μg), neomycin (10 μg), penicillin G (10 μg), rifampicin (5 μg) and vancomycin (30 μg).
Major menaquinone is MK-10(H6) with moderate amounts of MK-9(H6), MK-9(H8), MK-10(H8), MK-9(H4), MK-10(H4), MK-9(H10) and MK-10(H10).
Diagnostic phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol with minor amounts of phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylcholine and phosphatidylinositol and an unknown phospholipid.
Major fatty acid components are iso-C16 : 0, C16 : 0 and anteiso-C15 : 0.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 73.3 mol%.
The type strain, MCCC 1A01535T (=DSM 41943T=CGMCC 4.5510T), was isolated from the rhizosphere of the mangrove plant Avicennia mariana from Fujian Province, south China.
